title: Pumpkin Carving
body:
Ok, so this is inspired by @ironstrange-advent-calendar prompt, and somehow turned into a Supreme family fanfic. I had no idea that one of Spider-Man’s villains from the comics was Jack O’Lantern because I know nothing from the comics, though Ifound it and I had to add him in this thing, which is completly and utterly crack. Like, canon, who knows her? 

The point was, Stephen couldn’t refuse a damn thing to the kid. He didn’t even know why, by now, maybe it was because of his stupid puppy eyes, maybe because please him was so easy that Stephen didn’t have the heart to refuse him a thing, maybe because he grew to care about him during their stay in the Soul Dimension, he didn’t know.

What he knew, though, was that he wasn’t going to listen to him and Harley, ever again.

The point was, the youngest of his boyfriend’s kids – don’t deny it, Tony, you adopted both of them by now – seemed really interested in the Mystical Arts, and Stephen had always been the kind of person to encourage academic interest. Which was the reason why most of the times Harley was with Stephen in the library. Sometimes, Peter joined them too. and that kind of familiarly grew easily on Stephen. Especially when Tony arrived at the Sanctum as well and then the four of them just portalled in the Tower.

But he usually didn’t shove the two teenagers through the portal as he did that night. The point was: Wong wanted to bring a bit of Halloween spirit in Kamar-Taj and considering that it wasn’t a Nepalese festivity he stated that the pumpkins should have been enough. Which brought Harley at the realization that Tony loved Halloween, and they should totally carve pumpkins. Which was perfectly fine with Stephen, as far as he wasn’t involved.

But the teens decided to find a spell to help the Supreme Sorcerer to take part in this family ritual, and they succeed, in part.

Because neither of them spoke Latin.

“Babe!” Tony said the moment he saw the glowing portal opening in the middle of his workshop. Then, his whiskey brown eyes ran from his boyfriend’s face to the two kids he was with. “What did they do?”

“Why do you always think we did something, Tones?” Harley asked, and Stephen, despite being mad with them, couldn’t help a smile. Harley reminded to him of a younger version of Stephen himself.

“Because I’m looking at Stephen’s face right now. So, what happened?”

“Nothing Mr Stark we just…”

“They forced me into giving life to a sentient pumpkin,” Stephen said, and he glanced at Tony when he heard that he was starting to laugh.

“Forced you, doc?” Harley asked, cocking an eyebrow. “Since when ‘Hey this spell seems super cool because the pumpkin will stay lighted until you break it’ is forcing?”

The kid definitely spent too much time in Tony’s company, that was for sure. He huffed and seated on one of the chairs in the workshop, his attention fully back on his mobile phone while Peter was trying to find a way to apologize, and Tony tried not to laugh his ass off.

“So, after that you perform a spell on a pumpkin what happened? It attacked Wong because he was eating a soup made of its siblings? Please, tell me you took a picture.”

“It would be on Instagram if that happened,” Peter answered, a shy smile cracking through his worried expression now that it was clear that Tony didn’t make a great deal out of it. “No… It just… Walked out from the Sanctum and now there’s a sentient and friendly pumpkin around Greenwich Village.”

“And this is Shuri’s text,” Harley interrupted his friend. “She’s at the Compound and we really have to go because our princess friend is waiting for us.”

Stephen rolled his eyes at the ceiling. Of course, he forgot that T’Challa and Shuri were throwing a Halloween party in Wakanda and pretty much everyone who was under twenty-five had been invited. And Stephen didn’t expect for Tony to forbid them to go so, yeah, he and his boyfriend were going to spend Halloween night chasing for a sentient pumpkin, along with a sentient Cloak, very likely. That was his life now, not that Stephen was complaining.

– 

Not so surprisingly, the spell was stronger than Stephen guessed and the carved vegetable was probably smart enough to hide in plenty side because they walked around the Greenwich Village for almost two hours and there was no clarity of where it could have gone.

“You’re free to not believe me but when the kids told me they were going in Wakanda for a party, I pictured a very different night,” Tony said, after they decided that Central Park was a place as good as others to start their search for the missing pumpkin. “And Jack O’Lantern was not invited.”

Yeah, thank you so much, not that he was having fun. And he was also half sure that if Wong would have known about it nobody would have saved him from a lecture on how to read the side effects of the spells, before practising them. It wasn’t the first time either so it wasn’t like he could completely blame that incident on Peter and Harley.

“You can go home if you want,” Stephen said, even if he really hoped for his boyfriend to stay with him. Strange knew better and by now was sure that the moment they stopped the pumpkin he was going to study the spell and try to understand if it was the same that let the Cloak having its own mind. “It looks like this will take long enough.”

Tony shook his head. “No shit, babe! I want to see you play the fairy godmother and turn the carriage back. Let’s just hope it won’t disappoint any Cinderella.”

He smirked at him, and Stephen couldn’t help but smile back at his boyfriend. At least, they would have a night just for the two of them, even if it wasn’t what they both had hope for.

It took them almost four hours to find the pumpkin. A group of children had found it before and it didn’t look pleased with all when it saw Stephen, trying to run away from its creator. And that was the moment when things started to go down profusely.

The thing kind of evolved, or went shopping. considering that was wearing a suit, and from where its hands were supposed to be it could shoot fireballs.

“Great, next time try not to give them magic, honey!” Tony yelled, tapping the Arc Reactor and shooting at the thing the moment Stephen opened a couple of portals under the kids’ feet and portalled them in a safe place.

The pumpkin should have understood that Stephen was the one who could bring it back to his vegetable form because it was attacking only the sorcerer, which was a huge problem because it forced Stephen to defend himself instead of practising the counterspell. “I’ll keep that in mind, now, if you keep it occupied…”

The next blast hit the thing head even if wasn’t apparently enough to stop the creature, though the thing started to pay attention to Tony what was necessary to Stephen and the Cloak to block it. With a fast movement of his hands, he turned the thing back into the innocuous carved pumpkin which had been before.

By now, though, every person in the park seemed to have been attracted by the noises and the fires, and they probably thought it was a play or something because the crowd was cheer at them and a girl dressed as the Black Widow, and definitely the less shy in her Avenger-dressed friends, approached them.

“Wow, guys! That was a thing, and your costumes!” Her eyes were shining and when she focused them on Tony they grew even bigger. “Oh my… Dude, is that the latest Ironman’s suit? And the Cloak, it moved!”

At that, Cloak itself decided to make her point even clearer and waved at the girl. And Stephen knew that his boyfriend’s beautiful mind was working. Somehow, the sorcerer didn’t like that idea, right now. But then Tony removed his helmet, and the girl, her friends and whoever was close enough to see his face recognized him.

“Ok, guys, y’all are invited at the Stark Tower for having the greatest Avengers Halloween Party ever!” Stephen’s smile was soft, once he retrieved his suit and took Stephen’s hand. “Don’t you mind, babe, do you?”

Stephen shook his head. Tony always liked to throw parties whenever he could and Stephen was happy in knowing that the alcohol wasn’t any more the main attraction in those parties. He wanted to spend some time alone with Tony but he didn’t really mind to postpone it.

–

The day after, when Friday alerted them that Shuri, Harley, Peter, MJ and Ned arrived in the lobby, Stephen looked at his boyfriend’s still asleep at his side, a small and secret smile painted on his lips.

“We should wake up,” He whispered in Tony’s ear.

“Hmm.”

“You know that they’ll enter there…”

“Hey, guys!” MJ called, while from the kitchen came sounds of dishes and cutlery. “You’d better get dress because if you don’t show up in five minutes, Harley and I will finish Tony’s Italian coffee.”

That was enough for Tony to wake up completely. “I hate her,” he muttered, even if he was clearly joking. “Why have we approve our son dating her?”

“Maybe because May will kill you if you try to tell Peter he can’t date someone he likes,” Stephen replied, and he had to force himself to get out of the bed. He wasn’t tired, it was just that he didn’t plan to leave the bed at least that day.

In the end, he decided it was useless to wait longer and walked out of Tony’s bedroom.

“How was your party?” Stephen asked, looking at the teenagers.

“Super cool, Mr Doctor!” Peter said, and he couldn’t actually stay still on the chair. They all looked pretty on a sugar height but it was probably because of the time zone and the fact that they probably just had some coffees before leaving.

“And yours?” Shuri’s tone was smug to pair her smile.

“Oh, we chased Jack O’Lantern all night long,” Tony answered. “And then we discovered that you can’t give a moral compass to a conscious pumpkin so we had to fight it. Oh, we also invited a lot of people there and had a party until ass-o’clock in the morning.”

“Ok, Tony, whatever you say, we just asked to see Steph blush,” Harley replied, though the sorcerer was sure he was disappointed by the fact that he didn’t blush at all.

“Super cool, Mr Doctor!” Peter said, and he couldn’t actually stay still on the chair. They all looked pretty on a sugar height but it was probably because of the time zone and the fact that they probably just had some coffees before leaving.

“And yours?” Shuri’s tone was smug to pair her smile.

“Oh, we chased Jack O’Lantern all night long,” Tony answered. “And then we discovered that you can’t give a moral compass to a conscious pumpkin so we had to fight it. Oh, we also invited a lot of people there and had a party until ass-o’clock in the morning.”

“Ok, Tony, whatever you say, we just asked to see Steph blush,” Harley replied, though the sorcerer was sure he was disappointed by the fact that he didn’t blush at all.

The point was, Stephen couldn’t refuse a damn thing to the kid. He didn’t even know why, by now, maybe it was because of his stupid puppy eyes, maybe because please him was so easy that Stephen didn’t have the heart to refuse him a thing, maybe because he grew to care about him during their stay in the Soul Dimension, he didn’t know.

What he knew, though, was that he wasn’t going to listen to him and Harley, ever again.

The point was, the youngest of his boyfriend’s kids – don’t deny it, Tony, you adopted both of them by now – seemed really interested in the Mystical Arts, and Stephen had always been the kind of person to encourage academic interest. Which was the reason why most of the times Harley was with Stephen in the library. Sometimes, Peter joined them too. and that kind of familiarly grew easily on Stephen. Especially when Tony arrived at the Sanctum as well and then the four of them just portalled in the Tower.

But he usually didn’t shove the two teenagers through the portal as he did that night. The point was: Wong wanted to bring a bit of Halloween spirit in Kamar-Taj and considering that it wasn’t a Nepalese festivity he stated that the pumpkins should have been enough. Which brought Harley at the realization that Tony loved Halloween, and they should totally carve pumpkins. Which was perfectly fine with Stephen, as far as he wasn’t involved.

But the teens decided to find a spell to help the Supreme Sorcerer to take part in this family ritual, and they succeed, in part.

Because neither of them spoke Latin.

“Babe!” Tony said the moment he saw the glowing portal opening in the middle of his workshop. Then, his whiskey brown eyes ran from his boyfriend’s face to the two kids he was with. “What did they do?”

“Why do you always think we did something, Tones?” Harley asked, and Stephen, despite being mad with them, couldn’t help a smile. Harley reminded to him of a younger version of Stephen himself.

“Because I’m looking at Stephen’s face right now. So, what happened?”

“Nothing Mr Stark we just…”

“They forced me into giving life to a sentient pumpkin,” Stephen said, and he glanced at Tony when he heard that he was starting to laugh.

“Forced you, doc?” Harley asked, cocking an eyebrow. “Since when ‘Hey this spell seems super cool because the pumpkin will stay lighted until you break it’ is forcing?”

The kid definitely spent too much time in Tony’s company, that was for sure. He huffed and seated on one of the chairs in the workshop, his attention fully back on his mobile phone while Peter was trying to find a way to apologize, and Tony tried not to laugh his ass off.

“So, after that you perform a spell on a pumpkin what happened? It attacked Wong because he was eating a soup made of its siblings? Please, tell me you took a picture.”

“It would be on Instagram if that happened,” Peter answered, a shy smile cracking through his worried expression now that it was clear that Tony didn’t make a great deal out of it. “No… It just… Walked out from the Sanctum and now there’s a sentient and friendly pumpkin around Greenwich Village.”

“And this is Shuri’s text,” Harley interrupted his friend. “She’s at the Compound and we really have to go because our princess friend is waiting for us.”

Stephen rolled his eyes at the ceiling. Of course, he forgot that T’Challa and Shuri were throwing a Halloween party in Wakanda and pretty much everyone who was under twenty-five had been invited. And Stephen didn’t expect for Tony to forbid them to go so, yeah, he and his boyfriend were going to spend Halloween night chasing for a sentient pumpkin, along with a sentient Cloak, very likely. That was his life now, not that Stephen was complaining.

– 

[[MORE]]

Not so surprisingly, the spell was stronger than Stephen guessed and the carved vegetable was probably smart enough to hide in plenty side because they walked around the Greenwich Village for almost two hours and there was no clarity of where it could have gone.

“You’re free to not believe me but when the kids told me they were going in Wakanda for a party, I pictured a very different night,” Tony said, after they decided that Central Park was a place as good as others to start their search for the missing pumpkin. “And Jack O’Lantern was not invited.”

Yeah, thank you so much, not that he was having fun. And he was also half sure that if Wong would have known about it nobody would have saved him from a lecture on how to read the side effects of the spells, before practising them. It wasn’t the first time either so it wasn’t like he could completely blame that incident on Peter and Harley.

“You can go home if you want,” Stephen said, even if he really hoped for his boyfriend to stay with him. Strange knew better and by now was sure that the moment they stopped the pumpkin he was going to study the spell and try to understand if it was the same that let the Cloak having its own mind. “It looks like this will take long enough.”

Tony shook his head. “No shit, babe! I want to see you play the fairy godmother and turn the carriage back. Let’s just hope it won’t disappoint any Cinderella.”

He smirked at him, and Stephen couldn’t help but smile back at his boyfriend. At least, they would have a night just for the two of them, even if it wasn’t what they both had hope for.

It took them almost four hours to find the pumpkin. A group of children had found it before and it didn’t look pleased with all when it saw Stephen, trying to run away from its creator. And that was the moment when things started to go down profusely.

The thing kind of evolved, or went shopping. considering that was wearing a suit, and from where its hands were supposed to be it could shoot fireballs.

“Great, next time try not to give them magic, honey!” Tony yelled, tapping the Arc Reactor and shooting at the thing the moment Stephen opened a couple of portals under the kids’ feet and portalled them in a safe place.

The pumpkin should have understood that Stephen was the one who could bring it back to his vegetable form because it was attacking only the sorcerer, which was a huge problem because it forced Stephen to defend himself instead of practising the counterspell. “I’ll keep that in mind, now, if you keep it occupied…”

The next blast hit the thing head even if wasn’t apparently enough to stop the creature, though the thing started to pay attention to Tony what was necessary to Stephen and the Cloak to block it. With a fast movement of his hands, he turned the thing back into the innocuous carved pumpkin which had been before.

By now, though, every person in the park seemed to have been attracted by the noises and the fires, and they probably thought it was a play or something because the crowd was cheer at them and a girl dressed as the Black Widow, and definitely the less shy in her Avenger-dressed friends, approached them.

“Wow, guys! That was a thing, and your costumes!” Her eyes were shining and when she focused them on Tony they grew even bigger. “Oh my… Dude, is that the latest Ironman’s suit? And the Cloak, it moved!”

At that, Cloak itself decided to make her point even clearer and waved at the girl. And Stephen knew that his boyfriend’s beautiful mind was working. Somehow, the sorcerer didn’t like that idea, right now. But then Tony removed his helmet, and the girl, her friends and whoever was close enough to see his face recognized him.

“Ok, guys, y’all are invited at the Stark Tower for having the greatest Avengers Halloween Party ever!” Stephen’s smile was soft, once he retrieved his suit and took Stephen’s hand. “Don’t you mind, babe, do you?”

Stephen shook his head. Tony always liked to throw parties whenever he could and Stephen was happy in knowing that the alcohol wasn’t any more the main attraction in those parties. He wanted to spend some time alone with Tony but he didn’t really mind to postpone it.

–

The day after, when Friday alerted them that Shuri, Harley, Peter, MJ and Ned arrived in the lobby, Stephen looked at his boyfriend’s still asleep at his side, a small and secret smile painted on his lips.

“We should wake up,” He whispered in Tony’s ear.

“Hmm.”

“You know that they’ll enter there…”

“Hey, guys!” MJ called, while from the kitchen came sounds of dishes and cutlery. “You’d better get dress because if you don’t show up in five minutes, Harley and I will finish Tony’s Italian coffee.”

That was enough for Tony to wake up completely. “I hate her,” he muttered, even if he was clearly joking. “Why have we approve our son dating her?”

“Maybe because May will kill you if you try to tell Peter he can’t date someone he likes,” Stephen replied, and he had to force himself to get out of the bed. He wasn’t tired, it was just that he didn’t plan to leave the bed at least that day.

In the end, he decided it was useless to wait longer and walked out of Tony’s bedroom.

“How was your party?” Stephen asked, looking at the teenagers.

“Super cool, Mr Doctor!” Peter said, and he couldn’t actually stay still on the chair. They all looked pretty on a sugar height but it was probably because of the time zone and the fact that they probably just had some coffees before leaving.

“And yours?” Shuri’s tone was smug to pair her smile.

“Oh, we chased Jack O’Lantern all night long,” Tony answered. “And then we discovered that you can’t give a moral compass to a conscious pumpkin so we had to fight it. Oh, we also invited a lot of people there and had a party until ass-o’clock in the morning.”

“Ok, Tony, whatever you say, we just asked to see Steph blush,” Harley replied, though the sorcerer was sure he was disappointed by the fact that he didn’t blush at all.

Trying to break into the crazy world that is the entertainment industry, and in the meantime spending any free time reading & writing fanfiction. Or wasting time on tumblr when I should be writing. summary: We Are Love We Are One
title: We Are Love We Are One
body:
Contrary to what many – including his dolt of a brother – believed, travel between realms was more than possible without the use of the Bifrost. Loki had mastered it a long time ago, although he’d had little use for those skills since leaving Asgard several years ago with Tony. Midgard was his home now, the place where he’d built a life and, now, created a family. Loki glanced down at the child cradled in the crook of his arm. His child. The child he and Tony had brought into the world. The child that had made such a journey between world necessary.

Of course, if he’d called, Heimdall could easily have transported them to Asgard. But if he went via the Bifrost, Odin would know that he’d returned – however temporarily – and would attempt at best to detain him, and at worst to rip his child away from him. Instead, Loki used the hidden pathways only he knew.

Once in Asgard, it was easy enough to slip into the palace he’d once called his home and into the Queen’s chambers. Only for his mother would he risk his and his daughter’s lives such. Then he waited.

When he heard footsteps approach, Loki ducked into an alcove. He heard his mother’s voice through the door, dismissing her advisors, and a lump lodged itself in his throat. He’d missed her, ever since he said, “I’m sorry mother,” and teleported to Tony’s side to cling to his lover as Odin cast him into the Bifrost, back to Midgard beaten and broken. Loki glanced out after the door closed to ensure his mother was alone. Her solitude confirmed, he stepped out of the shadows.

Frigga noticed the movement instantly, her hands rising, ready to defend herself either by magic or by the knives Loki knew she had concealed at all times, until she recognised her youngest son.

“Loki,” she breathed.

“Hello mother.”

“What are you doing here?” she asked.

“I thought you might like to meet your granddaughter,” he replied.

He’d missed her, ever since he said, “I’m sorry mother,” and teleported to Tony’s side to cling to his lover as Odin cast him into the Bifrost, back to Midgard beaten and broken. Loki glanced out after the door closed to ensure his mother was alone. Her solitude confirmed, he stepped out of the shadows.

Frigga noticed the movement instantly, her hands rising, ready to defend herself either by magic or by the knives Loki knew she had concealed at all times, until she recognised her youngest son.

“Loki,” she breathed.

“Hello mother.”

“What are you doing here?” she asked.

“I thought you might like to meet your granddaughter,” he replied.

[1/1] friendships: Tony & Natasha

“I think [Natasha teaming up with Tony] was unexpected even for us but as we talked about it from a storytelling point of view, it really made sense because I think Black Widow is more pragmatic than we give her credit for. And sometimes she’s looking at the solutions from a different angle than Tony Stark, who’s very emotional. Even though they don’t react to the same things, in the same way, their conclusion that they came to ended up being the same.” — Nate Moor, executive producer of CA:CW

body:
A Link Between Time

Summary: Alternate Universe where Ben dies in the Battle of New York (by Loki’s hands). Peter meets Loki for the first time, and suddenly all the memories are coming back to him.

Warnings: my friend cried ig

PART 1 | PART 3

*****

After the painful interaction he just had, Peter moved to Tony’s lab and waited for him there. Not only did he want to stray away from Loki, but he wanted to be alone as he remembered the painful memories their conversation had brought up. Tears flew down the boys face, and he silently sobbed until Jarvis alerted the building of Tony’s arrival. Peter then washed the sorrow off his face.

When Tony walked in the room, Peter could feel his own breathing hitch. He hunched over the counter he stayed sat by, acting as if he had been working on homework, or even working on upgrades for his web shooters.

Peter heard Tony take several steps in the room, most likely towards the hunched kid. “So, you snuck in?” He softly joked, but Peter jumped high in fear. The kid seemed frantic, and he wouldn’t even face himself towards Tony. It was concerned, but Peter had odd habits that Tony had gotten used to. “Guess that’s a yes in ‘Youngster,’” Tony added.

Peter smacked himself with the palm of his hand. “Oh my god. Oh my god. Mr. Stark, I’m so sorry, I forgot I’m not supposed to be in here without you. I’m so sorry,” Peter’s voice was filled with quivers, disappointment and despair. Tony made a noise of concern, which caused Peter to feel worse than he probably should.

“Kid, you good there?” Tony questioned, stepping towards Peter until he stood beside him;then, he placed a hand on the teen’s soldier. Peter tensed up at the warm feeling of Tony’s hand, not because he felt uncomfortable, but because it was oddly comforting. “Did school suck today or something?” Tony’s question semi-snapped Peter out of the touch’s trance.

Peter tried moving away from Tony, but something told him he shouldn’t. Something kept him shaking under Tony’s fatherly touch. It could’ve been the fact that Peter knew he needed comfort at the moment, he knew he needed to cry his eyes out, but he couldn’t. A pitiful strain rose up Peter’s throat, begging for a loud, unwelcoming cry. With a small whimper, that he hoped Tony didn’t notice, Peter shot away the feeling. He took a deep breath, put on the best smile he could (despite still keeping his face turned away from Tony) and said, “no. I just… saw a cat with her kittens outside. I felt bad for them, and I guess my empathy got the best of me. I’m sorry.”

Tony hummed in response, and Peter almost felt relieved. Everything felt better the moment Tony released Peter, as he was able to relax and forget the whole reason why Peter had been shaky in the first place.

There was the quick sound of a drawer open, the loudness causing Peter to turn himself to the noise. It was Tony; he was taking out blueprints.

“The Patriotic Grandpa requested new equipment, and Bruce has been busy, so I figured you could help me with them,” Tony said.

“Oh. So, the Avengers are getting new stuff, and I get to help with it?” Peter would normally be shaking with the ecstatic feeling of being able to make equipment for the Avengers, but somebody made Peter dread this. Something told him he was going to fail, and that his equipment wouldn’t help in saving people. Just like…

“Uh, that’s kinda what I was implying,” Tony began, “and you also get to listen to me talk about the design points for like… fifteen minutes.” Peter did just that. Patiently he sat, anxiously listening to Tony as he quickly spoke about all the new equipment. Everybody was getting new uniforms, and several others getting new upgrades to any of their current weapons (and Natasha was getting a stress ball, because they’re all tired of her choking Steve.).

There was one last blueprint though, one that Tony noticeably hesitated in acknowledging.

“So, lastly, Thor convinced me to help design Loki a new… spear… or whatever it is. Either that, or just give him back the original one. Don’t know why, but-,“ Peter interrupted Tony with a sudden sob that broke out in his throat, causing him start coughing wetly. Tears built up in Peter’s eyes, begging to make their way out. “Peter?” From what Peter could see Tony had tears in his eyes too.

“Don’t… why would you consider… that?” Peter had trouble making words out, as they all were forced into a saddened slur and sloppy sobs. “He… so many died… he hurt them, killed them, and you don’t even know if he cares.”

*****

Peter couldn’t forget that day; nobody could. It was the day Loki terrorized New York, killed hundreds, maybe a bit more with the possible suicides caused from the day. Ben had to work that day, then he’d come home and join a young Peter and May for dinner. When Loki appeared, nobody expected it, and it was a fright to all. The day Ben… didn’t come home.

*****

Slightly violent shaking and a hug snapped Peter away from his memories. More glistening tears were streaming down his swollen cheeks. He hid his reddened face in the fabric of Tony’s jacket. This feeling was familiar, not the embarrassment of crying in public, but the same feeling Tony’s hug gave him.

“Kid. Hey Kid, Peter. Peter, it’s fine.” Peter heard from the older man.

He couldn’t focus on anything else Tony was saying. The teen felt as if he was in a drunken haze, there but barely conscious, like his mind was exiting his body to go on vacation. All Peter knew is that he held onto Tony as he drifted back off into his memories.

“Peter!” he heard Tony say one last time.

*****

“Peter. Peter… Peter! Wake up, let’s eat with Ben before he leaves.” May said to her sleepy five-year-old nephew, who’d been refusing to get out of bed. All she got was another whine before the child registered what May had said, and suddenly he flew himself out of bed.

May laughed. It was a normal day.

Peter ran up to his uncle, who’d already began eating himself. He ran up and jumped on his lap, giving the man a hug. “You’re not supposed to eat without family!” Peter puffed out his cheeks to seem more intimidating, but it only made his face look adorable and red.

“Well, you’re not supposed to sleep while the family is eating,” Ben bantered; Peter wasn’t going to try to argue against that logic. Instead, he climbed himself off of Ben and to his own seat, though he did need some help from May.

Peter swung his legs and giggled as they ate together. It was a normal day.

The young child almost didn’t let his uncle leave. “He can’t go!” Peter protested, “he’ll be gone too long, and I don’t want him gone!” May tried to coax the young child from being upset and forcing Ben to stay, but Peter couldn’t stop crying. “What if something happened to him?! What if the bad guys got to him?!” Peter was practically screeching at this point. He couldn’t stand the possibility of Ben being gone an entire day, and of him not coming home.

“Well, then Iron Man or Captain America will save me. Don’t worry, Pete. Anyways, Manhattan is a safe place,” Ben’s soothing words were able to calm Peter enough for Ben to leave. His aunt and uncle kissed each other a goodbye; Peter stuck his tongue out in disgust. It was a normal day.

Hours later, May and Peter were on the couch, Peter playing with a new ‘Crystal Making Kit’ and May awaiting her call from Ben. “Where’s Ben?” Peter asked, looking up from the formation of fake crystals in front of him.

“He’s probably getting out late,” May responded calmly. Peter shrugged, he believed May was telling the truth.

Suddenly, the phone began to ring. It was Ben. Peter ran in a attempt to answer the phone first, but the height of the counter was his downfall. Peter watched closely as May talked on the phone with Ben.

“Why turn on the news? What?” Peter heard May say from the kitchen. He was just as confused as May, and even more confused when the channels changed to their local News Channel. May suddenly fell silent at the sight.

“Close to Manhattan, there was a live murder of several men. The suspect has yet to give his name, but we suspect that this is a being we shall not mess with. He seems to be wearing a suit with- wait, his… He just… okay. He’s wearing what appears to be gold armor, green cape and a helmet with two horns. God, what type of man is this? Oh, Our cameras have just arrived. Please, be cautious around this man if you’re in the area of Manhattan.”

“May?” Peter was shaking. He didn’t know how to perceive this information or the look of panic on May’s face. “May!” He ran up to her, tugging her leg, begging for some sort of response.

He heard May say one thing, “please, just… get home safe.” It was to Ben. Peter, with tears streaming down his pinkish cheeks, silently admitted defeat and stared at the TV.

The cameras had already switched to the large amount of commotion being caused by the unnamed man. He held a golden spear with a glowing, blue stone in the middle. It matched the aesthetic of his armor, but as Peter watched the man, he didn’t feel the satisfying tingle he normally feels at such a match.

Peter jumped as the man used the spear to create a big ray of light, or he thought it was just light. As he saw a car get flipped from the magic of the spear, he realized it definitely wasn’t light.

There was a crowd of people around this man, running, screaming, they were all terrified. Hell, Peter wasn’t there and he was sweating like he’d just fled the scene. Among those people, Peter was able to spot a familiar tan jacket, but he ignored it, because there could be other people wearing the same jacket.

Suddenly, the unnamed man was trapping the group inside of multiple versions of himself. “Kneel before me,” the man said. He teleported away from the area, leaving a clone. Then, he was in front of the crowd, angry, ready to kill them all. “I said KNEEL!” Peter almost felt compelled to get on his knee, but his childish fear stopped him.

Peter didn’t listen to the monologue the man gave. He was more worried about May, who was still holding the phone to her ear, but silently. She was shaking, even crying. After Peter had heard the man finish speaking, May held her hand to her mouth. She was still staring at the TV. “Ben! Ben! Don’t do it!” She suddenly shouted. Peter looked at the TV again. Ben was there.

Ben, his uncle that he loved dearly, was standing in the sea of the kneeling people who were too scared to say anything. The man causing the chaos even looked shocked, almost impressed. They stared at each other, different goals in their eyes. It was a battle that we all knew who would lose. Ben gave a monologue of his own, one that made Peter walk closer to the TV, observe it more. He was proud of his uncle, that was until the light of dangerous man’s spear began to form again.

“Ben?” Peter questioned to the news being broadcasted, “why won’t you move?” Now, Peter was crying.

The light blasted from the spear, hitting Ben dead on. Peter could’ve sworn he saw red mixed with the blue light.

“Ben…” Peter whispered. “Ben!” He said again, but louder. May then pulled Peter into a hug. “Where’s Ben?!” He screamed through the sobs.

Ben had promised that one of Peter’s idols would’ve saved them, but he lied. Captain America landed seconds after Ben’s obliteration, and because of that, Ben didn’t come home that night. He’d never come home.

Peter suddenly preferred Iron Man over Captain America. He tried to think about the man in metal armor as he mourned for his uncle, but that couldn’t keep him from thinking about the man’s last moments alive.

That day definitely wasn’t a normal day.

*****

Peter hadn’t realized he’d recalled his memories aloud until he heard Tony apologizing frantically and felt the way the older man shook as he held Peter. “Gosh, if I had known… damn…” Tony said. Peter could hear the panic in his mentor’s voice, which only made him feel worse than he already had.

“It’s fine, Mr. Stark. It just… doesn’t make me feel too good, makes me feel dusty,” Peter said dryly.

“I know how it feels, kid. I’ll just set aside the blueprints, so nobody has to worry about… that day happening again,” Tony said.

Peter looked up at Tony, who had a painful attempt of a smile plastered on his face and nodded as if he were five again. They released each other from their comforting hugs, so Tony could organize his pile of projects.

“I’m gonna go wash off,” Peter muttered; before Tony could reply, Peter was already gone.

He stared himself in the mirror as he washed the salty tear stains from his cheeks, which were still warm from embarrassment. His hand glided down to his cracked lips, suffering from the dehydration of crying. Both his cheeks and lips matched the rest of his skin, red, irritated and suffering from his depressing trip down memory lane. Peter figured he would possibly break out in some places later, so he cleaned his skin the best he could and rejoined Stark.

As he walked alone, he thought of several things to himself. Would Tony force Thor to find another place for Loki to stay? Would he just keep Loki as far away from Peter as possible? Every possibility stayed in his mind, even the ones that involved the worst possible outcome for everybody around them.

He walked into the lab and was immediately greeted by Bruce, who arrived while Peter was cleaning himself. Normally, Peter was taken aback whenever he saw Bruce, but today he was too tired to. All he did was greet Bruce back.

“Hey kid!” Peter heard from the opposite side of the lab. “We’re adding extra legs to your iron suit. Let’s just say it’s a little gift from the tooth fairy.”

A small grin formed on Peter’s face. “Okay, Mr. Stark!”

Peter didn’t need to worry about his fears or Loki at the moment, all he needed to do was make sure his only fatherly figure didn’t stab himself with a metal spider leg.

PART 1 | PART 3

Tags: @t-rexhighfives @evil-9enguin @loki-redeemed-blog @whimsicalbarnes

Peter figured he would possibly break out in some places later, so he cleaned his skin the best he could and rejoined Stark.

As he walked alone, he thought of several things to himself. Would Tony force Thor to find another place for Loki to stay? Would he just keep Loki as far away from Peter as possible? Every possibility stayed in his mind, even the ones that involved the worst possible outcome for everybody around them.

He walked into the lab and was immediately greeted by Bruce, who arrived while Peter was cleaning himself. Normally, Peter was taken aback whenever he saw Bruce, but today he was too tired to. All he did was greet Bruce back.

“Hey kid!” Peter heard from the opposite side of the lab. “We’re adding extra legs to your iron suit. Let’s just say it’s a little gift from the tooth fairy.”

A small grin formed on Peter’s face. “Okay, Mr. Stark!”

Peter didn’t need to worry about his fears or Loki at the moment, all he needed to do was make sure his only fatherly figure didn’t stab himself with a metal spider leg.

trail.content_raw:
A Link Between Time

Summary: Alternate Universe where Ben dies in the Battle of New York (by Loki’s hands). Peter meets Loki for the first time, and suddenly all the memories are coming back to him.

Warnings: my friend cried ig

PART 1 | PART 3

*****

After the painful interaction he just had, Peter moved to Tony’s lab and waited for him there. Not only did he want to stray away from Loki, but he wanted to be alone as he remembered the painful memories their conversation had brought up. Tears flew down the boys face, and he silently sobbed until Jarvis alerted the building of Tony’s arrival. Peter then washed the sorrow off his face.

When Tony walked in the room, Peter could feel his own breathing hitch. He hunched over the counter he stayed sat by, acting as if he had been working on homework, or even working on upgrades for his web shooters.

Peter heard Tony take several steps in the room, most likely towards the hunched kid. “So, you snuck in?” He softly joked, but Peter jumped high in fear. The kid seemed frantic, and he wouldn’t even face himself towards Tony. It was concerned, but Peter had odd habits that Tony had gotten used to. “Guess that’s a yes in ‘Youngster,’” Tony added.

Peter smacked himself with the palm of his hand. “Oh my god. Oh my god. Mr. Stark, I’m so sorry, I forgot I’m not supposed to be in here without you. I’m so sorry,” Peter’s voice was filled with quivers, disappointment and despair. Tony made a noise of concern, which caused Peter to feel worse than he probably should.

“Kid, you good there?” Tony questioned, stepping towards Peter until he stood beside him;then, he placed a hand on the teen’s soldier. Peter tensed up at the warm feeling of Tony’s hand, not because he felt uncomfortable, but because it was oddly comforting. “Did school suck today or something?” Tony’s question semi-snapped Peter out of the touch’s trance.

Peter tried moving away from Tony, but something told him he shouldn’t. Something kept him shaking under Tony’s fatherly touch. It could’ve been the fact that Peter knew he needed comfort at the moment, he knew he needed to cry his eyes out, but he couldn’t. A pitiful strain rose up Peter’s throat, begging for a loud, unwelcoming cry. With a small whimper, that he hoped Tony didn’t notice, Peter shot away the feeling. He took a deep breath, put on the best smile he could (despite still keeping his face turned away from Tony) and said, “no. I just… saw a cat with her kittens outside. I felt bad for them, and I guess my empathy got the best of me. I’m sorry.”

Tony hummed in response, and Peter almost felt relieved. Everything felt better the moment Tony released Peter, as he was able to relax and forget the whole reason why Peter had been shaky in the first place.

There was the quick sound of a drawer open, the loudness causing Peter to turn himself to the noise. It was Tony; he was taking out blueprints.

“The Patriotic Grandpa requested new equipment, and Bruce has been busy, so I figured you could help me with them,” Tony said.

“Oh. So, the Avengers are getting new stuff, and I get to help with it?” Peter would normally be shaking with the ecstatic feeling of being able to make equipment for the Avengers, but somebody made Peter dread this. Something told him he was going to fail, and that his equipment wouldn’t help in saving people. Just like…

“Uh, that’s kinda what I was implying,” Tony began, “and you also get to listen to me talk about the design points for like… fifteen minutes.” Peter did just that. Patiently he sat, anxiously listening to Tony as he quickly spoke about all the new equipment. Everybody was getting new uniforms, and several others getting new upgrades to any of their current weapons (and Natasha was getting a stress ball, because they’re all tired of her choking Steve.).

There was one last blueprint though, one that Tony noticeably hesitated in acknowledging.

“So, lastly, Thor convinced me to help design Loki a new… spear… or whatever it is. Either that, or just give him back the original one. Don’t know why, but-,“ Peter interrupted Tony with a sudden sob that broke out in his throat, causing him start coughing wetly. Tears built up in Peter’s eyes, begging to make their way out. “Peter?” From what Peter could see Tony had tears in his eyes too.

“Don’t… why would you consider… that?” Peter had trouble making words out, as they all were forced into a saddened slur and sloppy sobs. “He… so many died… he hurt them, killed them, and you don’t even know if he cares.”

*****

Peter couldn’t forget that day; nobody could. It was the day Loki terrorized New York, killed hundreds, maybe a bit more with the possible suicides caused from the day. Ben had to work that day, then he’d come home and join a young Peter and May for dinner. When Loki appeared, nobody expected it, and it was a fright to all. The day Ben… didn’t come home.

*****

Slightly violent shaking and a hug snapped Peter away from his memories. More glistening tears were streaming down his swollen cheeks. He hid his reddened face in the fabric of Tony’s jacket. This feeling was familiar, not the embarrassment of crying in public, but the same feeling Tony’s hug gave him.

“Kid. Hey Kid, Peter. Peter, it’s fine.” Peter heard from the older man.

He couldn’t focus on anything else Tony was saying. The teen felt as if he was in a drunken haze, there but barely conscious, like his mind was exiting his body to go on vacation. All Peter knew is that he held onto Tony as he drifted back off into his memories.

“Peter!” he heard Tony say one last time.

*****

“Peter. Peter… Peter! Wake up, let’s eat with Ben before he leaves.” May said to her sleepy five-year-old nephew, who’d been refusing to get out of bed. All she got was another whine before the child registered what May had said, and suddenly he flew himself out of bed.

May laughed. It was a normal day.

Peter ran up to his uncle, who’d already began eating himself. He ran up and jumped on his lap, giving the man a hug. “You’re not supposed to eat without family!” Peter puffed out his cheeks to seem more intimidating, but it only made his face look adorable and red.

“Well, you’re not supposed to sleep while the family is eating,” Ben bantered; Peter wasn’t going to try to argue against that logic. Instead, he climbed himself off of Ben and to his own seat, though he did need some help from May.

Peter swung his legs and giggled as they ate together. It was a normal day.

The young child almost didn’t let his uncle leave. “He can’t go!” Peter protested, “he’ll be gone too long, and I don’t want him gone!” May tried to coax the young child from being upset and forcing Ben to stay, but Peter couldn’t stop crying. “What if something happened to him?! What if the bad guys got to him?!” Peter was practically screeching at this point. He couldn’t stand the possibility of Ben being gone an entire day, and of him not coming home.

“Well, then Iron Man or Captain America will save me. Don’t worry, Pete. Anyways, Manhattan is a safe place,” Ben’s soothing words were able to calm Peter enough for Ben to leave. His aunt and uncle kissed each other a goodbye; Peter stuck his tongue out in disgust. It was a normal day.

Hours later, May and Peter were on the couch, Peter playing with a new ‘Crystal Making Kit’ and May awaiting her call from Ben. “Where’s Ben?” Peter asked, looking up from the formation of fake crystals in front of him.

“He’s probably getting out late,” May responded calmly. Peter shrugged, he believed May was telling the truth.

Suddenly, the phone began to ring. It was Ben. Peter ran in a attempt to answer the phone first, but the height of the counter was his downfall. Peter watched closely as May talked on the phone with Ben.

“Why turn on the news? What?” Peter heard May say from the kitchen. He was just as confused as May, and even more confused when the channels changed to their local News Channel. May suddenly fell silent at the sight.

“Close to Manhattan, there was a live murder of several men. The suspect has yet to give his name, but we suspect that this is a being we shall not mess with. He seems to be wearing a suit with- wait, his… He just… okay. He’s wearing what appears to be gold armor, green cape and a helmet with two horns. God, what type of man is this? Oh, Our cameras have just arrived. Please, be cautious around this man if you’re in the area of Manhattan.”

“May?” Peter was shaking. He didn’t know how to perceive this information or the look of panic on May’s face. “May!” He ran up to her, tugging her leg, begging for some sort of response.

He heard May say one thing, “please, just… get home safe.” It was to Ben. Peter, with tears streaming down his pinkish cheeks, silently admitted defeat and stared at the TV.

The cameras had already switched to the large amount of commotion being caused by the unnamed man. He held a golden spear with a glowing, blue stone in the middle. It matched the aesthetic of his armor, but as Peter watched the man, he didn’t feel the satisfying tingle he normally feels at such a match.

Peter jumped as the man used the spear to create a big ray of light, or he thought it was just light. As he saw a car get flipped from the magic of the spear, he realized it definitely wasn’t light.

There was a crowd of people around this man, running, screaming, they were all terrified. Hell, Peter wasn’t there and he was sweating like he’d just fled the scene. Among those people, Peter was able to spot a familiar tan jacket, but he ignored it, because there could be other people wearing the same jacket.

Suddenly, the unnamed man was trapping the group inside of multiple versions of himself. “Kneel before me,” the man said. He teleported away from the area, leaving a clone. Then, he was in front of the crowd, angry, ready to kill them all. “I said KNEEL!” Peter almost felt compelled to get on his knee, but his childish fear stopped him.

Peter didn’t listen to the monologue the man gave. He was more worried about May, who was still holding the phone to her ear, but silently. She was shaking, even crying. After Peter had heard the man finish speaking, May held her hand to her mouth. She was still staring at the TV. “Ben! Ben! Don’t do it!” She suddenly shouted. Peter looked at the TV again. Ben was there.

Ben, his uncle that he loved dearly, was standing in the sea of the kneeling people who were too scared to say anything. The man causing the chaos even looked shocked, almost impressed. They stared at each other, different goals in their eyes. It was a battle that we all knew who would lose. Ben gave a monologue of his own, one that made Peter walk closer to the TV, observe it more. He was proud of his uncle, that was until the light of dangerous man’s spear began to form again.

“Ben?” Peter questioned to the news being broadcasted, “why won’t you move?” Now, Peter was crying.

The light blasted from the spear, hitting Ben dead on. Peter could’ve sworn he saw red mixed with the blue light.

“Ben…” Peter whispered. “Ben!” He said again, but louder. May then pulled Peter into a hug. “Where’s Ben?!” He screamed through the sobs.

Ben had promised that one of Peter’s idols would’ve saved them, but he lied. Captain America landed seconds after Ben’s obliteration, and because of that, Ben didn’t come home that night. He’d never come home.

Peter suddenly preferred Iron Man over Captain America. He tried to think about the man in metal armor as he mourned for his uncle, but that couldn’t keep him from thinking about the man’s last moments alive.

That day definitely wasn’t a normal day.

*****

Peter hadn’t realized he’d recalled his memories aloud until he heard Tony apologizing frantically and felt the way the older man shook as he held Peter. “Gosh, if I had known… damn…” Tony said. Peter could hear the panic in his mentor’s voice, which only made him feel worse than he already had.

“It’s fine, Mr. Stark. It just… doesn’t make me feel too good, makes me feel dusty,” Peter said dryly.

“I know how it feels, kid. I’ll just set aside the blueprints, so nobody has to worry about… that day happening again,” Tony said.

Peter looked up at Tony, who had a painful attempt of a smile plastered on his face and nodded as if he were five again. They released each other from their comforting hugs, so Tony could organize his pile of projects.

“I’m gonna go wash off,” Peter muttered; before Tony could reply, Peter was already gone.

He stared himself in the mirror as he washed the salty tear stains from his cheeks, which were still warm from embarrassment. His hand glided down to his cracked lips, suffering from the dehydration of crying. Both his cheeks and lips matched the rest of his skin, red, irritated and suffering from his depressing trip down memory lane. Peter figured he would possibly break out in some places later, so he cleaned his skin the best he could and rejoined Stark.

As he walked alone, he thought of several things to himself. Would Tony force Thor to find another place for Loki to stay? Would he just keep Loki as far away from Peter as possible? Every possibility stayed in his mind, even the ones that involved the worst possible outcome for everybody around them.

He walked into the lab and was immediately greeted by Bruce, who arrived while Peter was cleaning himself. Normally, Peter was taken aback whenever he saw Bruce, but today he was too tired to. All he did was greet Bruce back.

“Hey kid!” Peter heard from the opposite side of the lab. “We’re adding extra legs to your iron suit. Let’s just say it’s a little gift from the tooth fairy.”

A small grin formed on Peter’s face. “Okay, Mr. Stark!”

Peter didn’t need to worry about his fears or Loki at the moment, all he needed to do was make sure his only fatherly figure didn’t stab himself with a metal spider leg.

PART 1 | PART 3

title: PETER WHUMP DUMP LIST
body:
@goldenavenger02

In response to this post, I’m making another fic rec list. ENJOY

Shorter Peter whump fics.

Peter Whump Dump by Buckets_Of_Stars
(Yes, there is a series called ‘Peter Whump Dump”) Series of one-shots, various types of stories, all angst/whump. ONGOING
https://archiveofourown.org/series/870246

The Third Option by Uncertainty_Principle
(This story was deleted for a time but now the author is currently reuploading it.) ONE OF MY FAVORITES, heavy angst, poor Peter, pre-spider bite, eventual Iron Dad, only two chapter up by this point, still sooo good though! NOT COMPLETE.
https://archiveofourown.org/works/16023554/chapters/37395959

Forgive me by wolfypuppypiles
(You like whump? this author has tons of good stories) Hurt Peter, worried Tony, one-shot, COMPLETE.
https://archiveofourown.org/works/15386976

Sick by WindsOfWisteria
(HEED THE TAGS) Angst/dark, depressed/hurt Peter, suicide attempt, Tony feels, COMPLETE
https://archiveofourown.org/works/15027062/chapters/34835855

Peter Parker is young, dumb and reckless (and also in constant pain) by Minkey222
(Again, HEED THE TAGS) Series of connected one-shots, poor Peter, referenced child abuse, ONGOING
https://archiveofourown.org/series/1010577

Then I will carry you by elephreak
(Alternate Ending fic) ONE OF MY FAVORITES, Hurt Tony/Peter, one-shot, COMPLETE
https://archiveofourown.org/works/15751890

DNA by edema_ruh
(LONG one-shot) Sick/hurt Peter, Tony feels, one-shot, COMPLETE
https://archiveofourown.org/works/14784905

you can call me son by jaybaybay
(5 chapters) Hurt Peter, Tony takes care of him, COMPLETE
https://archiveofourown.org/works/15201329/chapters/35328255#workskin
